reviews.text: Very central location, helpful staff, accomodations were what we expected from the internet descriptions. We had a triple and double for a one night stay in Avignon. There were some issues with water leaking from a dehumidifier around windows, or so it seemed, but the staff tried to make amends. After 23hrs entrance is through the back door from a dark alley, but our group felt secure. Overall a good value, very good for our purposes, we would stay here again under similar circumstances. Parking available under Palais des Papes close by and convenient.
reviews.title: Convenient accomodations for a short stay in Avignon.

reviews.text: The worst hotel experience we have ever had. Staff lost our reservation, twice, then charged us for a room we didn’t stay in. Basically, we were charged for two hotel rooms even though we only stayed in one. This seems incomprehensible to us, although maybe due to the staff not using computers for reservations. After an hour and a half battle with the manager, we were still forced to pay for half the room. During this time, the manager was horribly rude and inconsiderate and gave us the worst display of public relations skills we have ever witnessed, yelling at us and refusing to admit the staff had made any errors. In addition to this, the cleaning staff kicked us out of our room at 9:30 on the last morning so they could make up our room, even though checkout wasn’t until noon. Rooms are in bad condition and outside streets are noisy. We stayed in another hotel in Avignon one night and it was superior in every way. This is an extremely poor hotel and we recommend against anyone staying there after the atrocious experience we had.
reviews.title: Worst Experience! Don't stay here!!

reviews.text: We stayed at the Danieli for five nights before Easter. Good location for foot travellers, being convenient for the train and bus stations as well as the centre of town. We found staff all very friendly and helpful, smoothing over any little glitches. There were several school parties staying for single nights during our visit who descended on the breakfast room like locusts. The rooms are plain but comfortable, with mobile fans etc, though this isn't an issue at this time of year.
reviews.title: No frills but friendly

reviews.text: Fantastic location on the main street and near all tourist activities. Staff is friendly and willing to assist with special needs. Rooms are large and furnished adequately. When hot, a portable a/c unit is provided in closet. What more could you ask?
reviews.title: Great value & location.

reviews.text: If you are looking for a basic hotel, centrally located & reasonably priced, then look no further. The rooms are clean and simplistic, so don't expect any frills. The room we had was small and the shower nozzle was handheld. There was a fan in our room which we made good use of. The hotel staff were helpful, particularly with restaurant recommendations.
reviews.title: Good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Danieli is an OK budget hotel in terms of room quality -- small bed (for two tall people), not all that comfortable -- but our room was clean if not well-lit. The location, however, is fantastic -- and even though it's on the main street, it's so set back behind double walls that it's quiet. The breakfast buffet was fine. The staff was helpful and friendly. Only one internet computer, but it was free.
reviews.title: Good budget hotel

reviews.text: First, everything in Avignon is beautifual and relaxing to me. And, the Hotel Danieli was a clean, extremely convenient and safe. That's all a solo female traveler on a budget can ask for. This hotel delivers.
reviews.title: Clean, convenient, but definately a budget hotel - exactly what I wanted!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Avoid the Hotel Danismelly!
Charming little hotel
reviews.text: -The ceilings need major work - drop ceilings were falling apart in places

reviews.title: Quaint, clean and friendly
reviews.text: -Would have been nice to have breakfast included in the room rate

reviews.title: good location, air cond?
reviews.text: We stayed here june 2004 and chose because of the location of the train station and walking sites. It has a good location but the air cond left much to be desired.

reviews.title: Very Pleasant Experience
reviews.text: There was a portable fan in the room for the air cond. The bed was uncomfortable-glad I was only there for one night. This was OK for one night but I would rethink if its the summer. There is no elevator here.

Excellent located hotel in the heart of Avignon. Very quiet rooms, we could have windows open all night. No ordinary air-condition, but with a portable water-based unit and windows open we slept very well.
reviews.title: Excellent location
Primely located but...
reviews.text: Nice breakfast. Ok service - but we observed the hostess being very warm and friendly to some of the other guests, but she was a bit cold and polite correct to us for some reason :-?

reviews.title: Some issues
reviews.text: A nice two star hotel, could stay here again.

reviews.title: Great Location!
reviews.text: We'd stayed for 4 nights. Heat wave continued and we couldn't sleep well on the first night though a mobile fan was on. Weak shower with almost no hot water coming out. We freezed for a few seconds after the cold shower in the morning. At last staff there changed a room for us and this time the shower was OK.

reviews.title: Cozy and Clean
reviews.text: Not recommended for hot summer stay but it was a budget choice for those who look for somewhere conveniently located in the old town. Baby dolls/toddlers decoration throughout the corridors was not to our taste.It was OK as long as it was not inside the rooms.
